str:Codelist.com:Name: Methodology
str:Codelist.com:Description: This codelist identifies the specific statistical methodologies and conceptual frameworks used in the collection, processing, analysis, and presentation of data within a dataset.

str:Code.com:Name: Balance of Payments Statistics (BOP) Statistics
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical framework for recording and classifying international transactions.

str:Code.com:Name: Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual, Sixth Edition (BPM6)
str:Code.com:Description: Updated in 2009, BPM6 incorporates changes in the global economy like globalization and financial innovation. It provides a more integrated approach to balance of payments and international investment position statistics.

str:Code.com:Name: Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual 6th Edition (BPM6): Memorandum Items
str:Code.com:Description: Refers to additional items in BPM6 that provide supplementary information.

str:Code.com:Name: Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual 6th Edition (BPM6): Standard Component
str:Code.com:Description: Refers to the core components of the BPM6 framework.

str:Code.com:Name: Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual 6th Edition (BPM6): Supplementary Items
str:Code.com:Description: Refers to additional items in BPM6 that provide supplementary information.

str:Code.com:Name: International Investment Position (IIP)
str:Code.com:Description: Statistics that measure a country's stock of foreign assets and liabilities.

str:Code.com:Name: International Investment Position (IIP): Standard Component
str:Code.com:Description: Refers to the core components of the IIP framework.

str:Code.com:Name: International Investment Position (IIP): Supplementary Items
str:Code.com:Description: Refers to additional items in the IIP framework that provide supplementary information.

str:Code.com:Name: Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual, Fifth Edition (BPM5)
str:Code.com:Description: A comprehensive guide to compiling balance of payments and international investment position statistics, published in 1993. It provides a framework for recording and classifying international transactions.

str:Code.com:Name: Central Product Classification (CPC)
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/unsdclassifications/cpcv21.pdf

str:Code.com:Name: Classification by Broad Economic Categories (BEC)
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/trade/classifications/bec.asp

str:Code.com:Name: Consumer Price Statistics
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical method for measuring changes in the prices of consumer goods and services.

str:Code.com:Name: COICOP 1999
str:Code.com:Description: Classification of Individual Consumption According to Purpose (COICOP) 1999; https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Econ/Download/In%20Text/CPCprov_english.pdf

str:Code.com:Name: COICOP 2018
str:Code.com:Description: Classification of Individual Consumption According to Purpose (COICOP) 2018; https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/unsdclassifications/COICOP_2018_-_pre-edited_white_cover_version_-_2018-12-26.pdf

str:Code.com:Name: Commodity Statistics
str:Code.com:Description: StatistA statistical framework for collecting and analyzing data on the production, trade, and consumption of commodities.

str:Code.com:Name: Coordinated Direct Investment Survey Guide 2015 (CDIS 2015)
str:Code.com:Description: Provides guidance on conducting surveys of foreign direct investment, covering data collection, processing, and analysis.

str:Code.com:Name: Coordinated Portfolio Investment Survey Guide 2017 (CPIS 2017)
str:Code.com:Description: Provides guidance on conducting surveys of portfolio investment, covering data collection, processing, and analysis.

str:Code.com:Name: European System of Accounts 1995 (ESA 1995)
str:Code.com:Description: The European Union's version of the System of National Accounts, providing a framework for macroeconomic accounting within the EU.

str:Code.com:Name: European System of Accounts 2010 (ESA 2010)
str:Code.com:Description: An update to ESA 1995, aligning with SNA 2008 and incorporating changes in the European economy.

str:Code.com:Name: Exchange Rate (ER)
str:Code.com:Description: Statistical methods for determining and analyzing the price of one currency in terms of another currency.

str:Code.com:Name: Financial Access Survey Guidelines and Manual 2019 (FAS 2019)
str:Code.com:Description: Provides guidance on measuring financial access and inclusion, covering access to financial institutions and usage of financial products.

str:Code.com:Name: Financial Soundness Indicators Compilation Guide 2019 (FSI 2019)
str:Code.com:Description: Offers guidance on compiling financial soundness indicators, which assess the stability and resilience of financial systems.

str:Code.com:Name: Fund Accounts (FA)
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical framework for recording and reporting the financial activities of international financial institutions like the IMF.

str:Code.com:Name: Government Finance Statistics (GFS)
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical framework for collecting and presenting data on government revenue, expenditure, and debt.

str:Code.com:Name: Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014 (GFSM 2014)
str:Code.com:Description: This edition builds on GFSM 2001, with updates to reflect changes in public sector accounting standards and practices. It also includes new guidance on public corporations and natural resource wealth.

str:Code.com:Name: Government Finance Statistics Manual 2001 (GFSM 2001)
str:Code.com:Description: A guide for compiling government finance statistics, focusing on the accrual accounting approach. It covers revenue, expense, assets, and liabilities of government units.

str:Code.com:Name: Government Finance Statistics Manual 1986 (GFSM 1986)
str:Code.com:Description: An earlier framework for compiling government finance statistics.

str:Code.com:Name: Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding Systems (HS), Rev. 5
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/tradekb/Knowledgebase/50018/Harmonized-Commodity-Description-and-Coding-Systems-HS

str:Code.com:Name: Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC)
str:Code.com:Description: Statistical and scientific methods used by the IPCC to assess climate change.

str:Code.com:Name: International Classification of Status in Employment 1993 (ICSE 1993)
str:Code.com:Description: http://www.ilo.org/global/statistics-and-databases/statistics-overview-and-topics/status-in-employment/current-guidelines/lang--en/index.htm

str:Code.com:Name: International Labor Organization (ILO)
str:Code.com:Description: Statistical standards and guidelines related to labor issues, developed by the International Labor Organization.

str:Code.com:Name: International Merchandise Trade Statistics (IMTS)
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical framework for measuring the flow of goods across international borders.

str:Code.com:Name: International Merchandise Trade Statistics: Concepts and Definitions 2010 (IMTS 2010)
str:Code.com:Description: Provides a framework for compiling international merchandise trade statistics, covering concepts, definitions, and classifications.

str:Code.com:Name: International Recommendations for Tourism Statistics 2008 (IRTS 2008)
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/tradekb/Knowledgebase/50551/IRTS-2008

str:Code.com:Name: International Reserves and Foreign Currency Liquidity: Guidelines for a Data Template 2013 (IRFCL 2013)
str:Code.com:Description: Offers guidelines for compiling data on international reserves and foreign currency liquidity, focusing on data consistency and transparency.

str:Code.com:Name: International Standard Classification of Education 2011 (ISCED 2011)
str:Code.com:Description: http://www.uis.unesco.org/Education/Pages/international-standard-classification-of-education.aspx

str:Code.com:Name: International Standard Industrial Classification (ISIC)
str:Code.com:Description: A standard classification system used in statistical analysis to categorize economic activities.

str:Code.com:Name: International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities, Rev. 3 (ISIC Rev. 3)
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Econ/ISIC.cshtml

str:Code.com:Name: International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities, Rev. 3.1 (ISIC Rev. 3.1) 2004
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Econ/ISIC.cshtml

str:Code.com:Name: International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities, Rev. 4 (ISIC Rev. 4) 2008
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Econ/ISIC.cshtml

str:Code.com:Name: Monetary and Financial Statistics (MFS)
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical framework for collecting and analyzing data on money supply, credit, and financial institutions.

str:Code.com:Name: Monetary and Financial Statistics Manual and Compilation Guide 2016 (MFS 2016)
str:Code.com:Description: Provides a framework for compiling monetary and financial statistics, covering financial institutions, instruments, and markets. It aims to promote consistency and cross-country comparability.

str:Code.com:Name: Monetary and Financial Statistics Manual and Compilation Guide 2016 (MFS 2016), Concepts Based on Euro Area Wide Residency
str:Code.com:Description: A version of MFS16 adapted for the specific circumstances of the Euro Area.

str:Code.com:Name: National Accounts Statistics (SNA)
str:Code.com:Description: A statistical framework for macroeconomic accounting, providing a consistent system for measuring economic activity.

str:Code.com:Name: System of National Accounts 1993 (SNA 1993)
str:Code.com:Description: A comprehensive framework for macroeconomic accounting, providing a consistent system for measuring economic activity. It covers production, income, consumption, and capital formation.

str:Code.com:Name: System of National Accounts 2008 (SNA 2008)
str:Code.com:Description: An update to SNA 1993, incorporating changes in economic activity and measurement. It includes new guidance on financial services, globalization, and the environment.

str:Code.com:Name: OECD Benchmark Definition of Foreign Direct Investment (BMD4)
str:Code.com:Description: The OECD's definition of foreign direct investment, providing guidance on measuring and classifying FDI.

str:Code.com:Name: Per National Definition
str:Code.com:Description: Indicates that the definition or methodology is determined by each country's own standards.

str:Code.com:Name: Population Statistics
str:Code.com:Description: Statistical methods for collecting and analyzing data on the size, distribution, and characteristics of populations.

str:Code.com:Name: Quality Assurance (QA)
str:Code.com:Description: Statistical standards and procedures used to ensure the quality of data and statistics.

str:Code.com:Name: Standard International Trade Classification, Rev. 2 (SITC Rev. 2) 1975
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Family/Detail/1070

str:Code.com:Name: Standard International Trade Classification, Rev. 4 (SITC Rev. 4) 2007
str:Code.com:Description: https://unstats.un.org/unsd/publications/catalogue?selectID=104

str:Code.com:Name: Statistical Classification of Economic Activities in the European Community, Rev. 2 (NACE Rev. 2) 2008
str:Code.com:Description: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3859598/5902521/KS-RA-07-015-EN.PDF https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/nomenclatures/index.cfm?TargetUrl=LST_NOM_DTL&StrNom=NACE_REV2&StrLanguageCode=EN

str:Code.com:Name: Statistical classification of products by activity 2008 (CPA 2008)
str:Code.com:Description: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/nomenclatures/index.cfm?TargetUrl=LST_NOM_DTL&StrNom=CPA_2008&StrLanguageCode=EN&IntPcKey=&StrLayoutCode=HIERARCHIC

str:Code.com:Name: Producer Price Index Manual: Theory and Practice
str:Code.com:Description: https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/Manuals-Guides/Issues/2016/12/30/Producer-Price-Index-Manual-Theory-and-Practice-16966

str:Code.com:Name: Monetary and Financial Statistics Manual and Compilation Guide 2000 (MFS 2000)
str:Code.com:Description: An earlier version of the MGS manual, providing similar guidance for compiling monetary and financial statistics.

str:Code.com:Name: International Recommendations for the Index of Industrial Production 2010
str:Code.com:Description: A global guideline for countries to uniformly measure and report industrial output changes (Index of Industrial Production - IIP), ensuring international data comparability.

str:Code.com:Name: Monetary and Financial Statistics non-standard reporting
str:Code.com:Description: The Monetary and Financial Statistics (MFS) nonstandard dataset is compiled using country-specific methodologies and terminology, rather than the standard methodology outlined in different versions of Monetary and Financial Statistics Manual.

str:Code.com:Name: Export and Import Price Index Manual: Theory and Practice 2009
str:Code.com:Description: This manual provides guidance on how to construct a price index for exports and imports. It is relevant to statistical agencies involved in the compilation of export and import price indexes. This 2009 edition updates the 1999 edition and incorporates recent methodological advances. https://www.imf.org/-/media/files/data/manuals-guides/eipim_2009_book.ashx

str:Code.com:Name: Monetary and Financial Statistics Compilation Guide 2008
str:Code.com:Description: This guide provides a framework for compiling monetary and financial statistics, offering practical advice and examples to statistical compilers. It is designed to assist countries in producing high-quality monetary and financial statistics that are comparable internationally. https://www.imf.org/-/media/Files/Data/manuals-guides/mfs-guide-2008.ashx

str:Code.com:Name: A Guide to Money and Banking Statistics in IFS 1984
str:Code.com:Description: This guide explains the methodology and concepts used in compiling money and banking statistics for the International Financial Statistics (IFS). It is relevant to users and compilers of these statistics, providing context for the data presented in the IFS.

str:Code.com:Name: International Merchandise Trade Statistics 1998 (IMTS 1998)
str:Code.com:Description: This manual provides a framework of concepts and definitions for the compilation of international merchandise trade statistics. It is relevant to national statistical authorities involved in collecting, compiling, and disseminating trade data, promoting international comparability.

str:Code.com:Name: Balance of Payments Manual, fourth edition (BPM4)
str:Code.com:Description: This manual sets forth the conceptual framework for the compilation of balance of payments statistics. It provides guidelines for statistical agencies to ensure consistency and comparability of balance of payments data across countries.

str:Code.com:Name: External Debt Statistics Guide 2013 (EDS 2013)
str:Code.com:Description: This guide provides comprehensive methodological guidance for the compilation, dissemination, and use of external debt statistics. It is relevant to compilers in national statistical agencies, central banks, and ministries of finance, as well as to users of external debt data. https://www.imf.org/-/media/Files/Data/manuals-guides/eds_guide2013.ashx

str:Code.com:Name: External Debt Statistics Guide 2003 (EDS 2003)
str:Code.com:Description: This guide provides methodological guidance for the compilation, dissemination, and use of external debt statistics. It was a predecessor to the 2013 edition, offering a framework for data collection and presentation relevant to the period. https://www.imf.org/-/media/Files/Data/manuals-guides/eds_guide2003.ashx

str:Code.com:Name: Consumer Price Index Manual 2004 (CPI 2004)
str:Code.com:Description: This manual provides guidelines for statistical offices and other agencies responsible for constructing Consumer Price Indexes (CPIs), explaining methods, underlying economic and statistical concepts, and principles. https://www.elibrary.imf.org/display/book/9789221136996/9789221136996.xml

str:Code.com:Name: Producer Price Index Manual 2004 (PPI 2004)
str:Code.com:Description: This manual provides clear, up-to-date guidance on the concepts, uses, methods, and economic theory of the Producer Price Index (PPI), including information on classifications, sources, compilation techniques, and analytical uses. It supersedes previous international guidance on PPIs. https://www.elibrary.imf.org/display/book/9781589063044/9781589063044.xml

str:Code.com:Name: Consumer Price Index Manual 2020 (CPI 2020)
str:Code.com:Description: This manual, an update of the 2004 CPI Manual, provides comprehensive information and explanations on compiling a consumer price index (CPI). Its primary purpose is to assist countries in producing CPIs that reflect internationally recommended methods and practices. https://www.elibrary.imf.org/display/book/9781484354841/9781484354841.xml
